main event: Multiple sightings and observations of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in various locations, including Phoenix, Arizona, and Hood River, Oregon, in 1948.
interesting points: Strange green fireball seen over Phoenix, Arizona, described to have a slow speed and erratic side motions.
Reports of bright flashes of light and unusual noises accompanying UFO sightings in different locations.
Observations of a falling light with changing colors and a red trail, appearing to move in a controlled manner and not falling straight to the earth.
Testimonies of sightings from credible witnesses, including personnel from the Atomic Energy Service and various inspectors, adding to the credibility of the reported events.

Efforts made to investigate and understand the nature of the observed phenomena, including inquiries with astronomy professionals and efforts to create comprehensive reports with maps for precise documentation.
location: Phoenix, Arizona, and Hood River, Oregon, as well as other locations in New Mexico.
witnesses: multiple credible witnesses including inspectors and professionals from the Atomic Energy Service.
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
